purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module to record a class of involvement in an activity.
The nature of an involvement in an individual activity may be specified by indicating a class of involvement in which it is a member.

ul.li: the class of person 'stress engineer'; and

example.p: is a Class of involvement in activity.
The cardinality for this relationship is follows:

ul.li: a stress engineer may be involved in zero, one or many stress analysis activities;
a stress analysis activity has one or many stress engineers involved in it.

example.p: The involvement of John Doe, who is a stress engineer at Joe Bloggs and Co., and the stress analysis of part XYZ_123 carried out on 2001-05-02, is classified as 'stress analysis performer'.

purpose.note: The cardinality for the relationship is within the scope of the Cardinality_of_relationship application module.

li.p: a mapping between a class of activity and a class of product, document, organization, or person that indicates the nature of an involvement in an activity.

li.note: Individual involvement in activity is within the scope of the Individual_involvement_in_activity application module.

li.p: membership of a class of involvement in activity.
li.note: Membership of a class of involvement in activity is within the scope of the Activity_structure_and_classification application module.

uof.name: Class_of_involvement_in_activity
uof.description: The Class_of_involvement_in_activity UoF identifies a class of involvement in an activity and defines the classes of thing that play a role.
